#!/usr/bin/env python
# coding: utf-8

import datetime
import time
import os
import re
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, when, lit, regexp_replace, trim, upper, substring, to_date, date_format, expr
from pyspark.sql.types import StringType, IntegerType, TimestampType, LongType, DateType
import pyspark.sql.functions as F

# Configuration
storage_account = "baubaisadfsaprod"
input_dir = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_postgresql"
output_dir = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports"

# Max records per batch (for large datasets)
MAX_RECORDS_PER_BATCH = 2000000

# Ensure output directory exists
if not mssparkutils.fs.exists(output_dir):
    mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(output_dir)

# Define a function for aggressive address field sanitization
def sanitize_address_field(column):
    # Replace apostrophes with nothing
    cleaned = regexp_replace(column, "'", "")
    # Replace quotes with nothing
    cleaned = regexp_replace(cleaned, '"', "")
    # Replace backslashes with forward slashes
    cleaned = regexp_replace(cleaned, "\\\\", "/")
    # Replace multiple spaces with single space
    cleaned = regexp_replace(cleaned, "\\s+", " ")
    # Remove any non-ASCII characters (using a pattern that matches non-ASCII)
    cleaned = regexp_replace(cleaned, "[^\\x00-\\x7F]+", "")
    # Remove any other problematic characters (keep alphanumeric, spaces, periods, commas, slashes, hyphens, and #)
    cleaned = regexp_replace(cleaned, "[^\\w\\s.,/\\-#]", "")
    return cleaned

# Define a function for basic non-address field sanitization
def sanitize_non_address_field(column):
    # Less aggressive cleaning for non-address fields
    # Just remove apostrophes and quotes
    cleaned = regexp_replace(column, "'", "")
    cleaned = regexp_replace(cleaned, '"', "")
    return cleaned

try:
    print(f"üîÑ Processing all partitioned parquet data in {input_dir}")
    
    # Read all parquet data from the directory (including partitions)
    df = spark.read.parquet(input_dir)
    record_count = df.count()
    print(f"   ‚úÖ Read {record_count} records from all partitions")
    
    # Drop creation_date_partition column if it exists (has 26 columns)
    columns = df.columns
    if len(columns) == 26 and "creation_date_partition" in columns:
        df = df.drop("creation_date_partition")
        print("   ‚úÖ Dropped creation_date_partition column")
    
    # Apply data cleaning and transformation (from DataType_transformed_batch_Pyspark_01.py)
    print("   üßπ Cleaning and transforming data...")
    
    # 1. Clean dob column format
    if "dob" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn(
            "dob",
            when(
                col("dob").isNotNull(),
                to_date(col("dob"), "dd/MM/yyyy")
            ).otherwise(None)
        )
        df = df.withColumn("dob", date_format(col("dob"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))
        print("   ‚úÖ Normalized dob column format")
    
    # 2. Force proper string type for flags and new_marker column
    invalid_values = ["", "nan", "NaN", "None", "NONE", "null", "NULL", "nan.0"]
    
    if "new_marker" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("new_marker", trim(col("new_marker").cast(StringType())))
        df = df.withColumn(
            "new_marker",
            when(
                col("new_marker").isin(invalid_values),
                None
            ).otherwise(col("new_marker"))
        )
        # Apply basic sanitization
        df = df.withColumn("new_marker", sanitize_non_address_field(col("new_marker")))
        print("   ‚úÖ Cleaned new_marker column")
    
    if "flags" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("flags", trim(col("flags").cast(StringType())))
        df = df.withColumn(
            "flags",
            when(
                col("flags").isin(invalid_values),
                None
            ).otherwise(col("flags"))
        )
        # Apply basic sanitization
        df = df.withColumn("flags", sanitize_non_address_field(col("flags")))
        print("   ‚úÖ Cleaned flags column")
    
    # 3. Force the data type for title column
    if "title" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("title", trim(col("title").cast(StringType())))
        df = df.withColumn(
            "title",
            when(
                col("title").isin(invalid_values),
                None
            ).otherwise(col("title"))
        )
        
        # Truncate title to 10 characters max
        df = df.withColumn(
            "title",
            when(
                F.length(col("title")) > 10,
                substring(col("title"), 1, 10)
            ).otherwise(col("title"))
        )
        
        # Apply basic sanitization
        df = df.withColumn("title", sanitize_non_address_field(col("title")))
        print("   ‚úÖ Cleaned title column")
    
    # 4. Fix register_lett
    if "register_lett" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn(
            "register_lett",
            substring(trim(col("register_lett").cast(StringType())), 1, 5)
        )
        # Apply basic sanitization
        df = df.withColumn("register_lett", sanitize_non_address_field(col("register_lett")))
        print("   ‚úÖ Fixed register_lett column")
    
    # 5. Make sure poll_number is properly formatted (5 characters max)
    if "poll_number" in df.columns:
        # First convert to numeric to clean up potential float values (.0)
        df = df.withColumn(
            "poll_number",
            when(
                col("poll_number").cast("double").isNotNull(),
                col("poll_number").cast("int").cast(StringType())
            ).otherwise(col("poll_number").cast(StringType()))
        )
        # Then truncate to 5 characters
        df = df.withColumn(
            "poll_number",
            substring(trim(col("poll_number")), 1, 5)
        )
        # Apply basic sanitization
        df = df.withColumn("poll_number", sanitize_non_address_field(col("poll_number")))
        print("   ‚úÖ Fixed poll_number column")
    
    # 6. Ensure hash_id is properly formatted
    if "hash_id" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn(
            "hash_id",
            when(
                col("hash_id").isNull(),
                # Generate a new hash_id if missing using a combination of fields
                F.xxhash64(
                    F.concat_ws(
                        "||",
                        F.trim(F.coalesce(col("register_lett"), lit(""))),
                        F.trim(F.coalesce(col("poll_number"), lit(""))),
                        F.upper(F.trim(F.coalesce(col("fname"), lit("")))),
                        F.upper(F.trim(F.coalesce(col("lname"), lit("")))),
                        F.trim(F.coalesce(col("rec_num"), lit(""))),
                        F.trim(F.coalesce(col("zip"), lit(""))),
                        F.trim(F.coalesce(col("address"), lit("")))
                    )
                )
            ).otherwise(col("hash_id"))
        )
        print("   ‚úÖ Validated hash_id column")
    
    # 7. Clean creation_date
    if "creation_date" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn(
            "creation_date",
            when(
                col("creation_date").isNotNull(),
                to_date(col("creation_date").cast(StringType()), "yyyyMMdd")
            ).otherwise(None)
        )
        # Format as YYYY-MM-DD for PostgreSQL
        df = df.withColumn("creation_date", date_format(col("creation_date"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))
        
        # Filter out rows with invalid creation_date
        df = df.filter(col("creation_date").isNotNull())
        print("   ‚úÖ Cleaned creation_date column")
    
    # 8. Apply address-specific sanitization to all address fields
    address_columns = [c for c in df.columns if "address" in c.lower() or c.lower() == "zip"]
    print(f"   üßπ Applying aggressive sanitization to {len(address_columns)} address columns: {address_columns}")
    
    for address_col in address_columns:
        if address_col in df.columns:
            # Apply aggressive sanitization to address fields
            df = df.withColumn(address_col, sanitize_address_field(col(address_col)))
    
    # 8b. Replace empty address4 with "UNKNOWN"
    if "address4" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn(
            "address4",
            when(
                col("address4").isNull() | (trim(col("address4")) == ""),
                lit("UNKNOWN")
            ).otherwise(col("address4"))
        )
        print("   ‚úÖ Ensured address4 column has no NULL values")
    
    # 9. Apply basic sanitization to name fields
    name_columns = ["fname", "lname"]
    for name_col in name_columns:
        if name_col in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn(name_col, sanitize_non_address_field(col(name_col)))
    
    # 10. Remove records with empty name fields (critical data quality check)
    if "fname" in df.columns and "lname" in df.columns:
        df = df.filter(
            col("fname").isNotNull() & (trim(col("fname")) != "") &
            col("lname").isNotNull() & (trim(col("lname")) != "")
        )
        print("   ‚úÖ Removed records with empty name fields")
    
    # Check final record count after cleaning
    final_count = df.count()
    print(f"   ‚úÖ Final dataset contains {final_count} cleaned records (removed {record_count - final_count} problematic records)")
    
    # Determine if we need to split into batches
    need_batches = final_count > MAX_RECORDS_PER_BATCH
    
    # Generate CSV output(s)
    timestamp = datetime.datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
    
    if need_batches:
        print(f"   ‚ö†Ô∏è Dataset exceeds {MAX_RECORDS_PER_BATCH} records, splitting into batches")
        
        # Calculate number of batches needed
        num_batches = (final_count + MAX_RECORDS_PER_BATCH - 1) // MAX_RECORDS_PER_BATCH
        
        # Create a column for batching
        df = df.withColumn("batch_id", (F.monotonically_increasing_id() / MAX_RECORDS_PER_BATCH).cast("int"))
        
        # Process each batch
        for batch_num in range(num_batches):
            batch_df = df.filter(col("batch_id") == batch_num).drop("batch_id")
            batch_count = batch_df.count()
            
            print(f"   üì¶ Processing batch {batch_num + 1}/{num_batches} with {batch_count} records")
            
            # Write to temporary CSV folder
            temp_output_dir = f"{output_dir}/temp_batch{batch_num}_{timestamp}"
            
            batch_df.coalesce(1).write \
                .option("header", "true") \
                .option("quoteAll", "true") \
                .option("escape", "\\") \
                .option("quoteMode", "quoteMode.ALL") \
                .option("lineSep", "\n") \
                .mode("overwrite") \
                .csv(temp_output_dir)
            
            # Locate and rename the .csv file
            files_written = mssparkutils.fs.ls(temp_output_dir)
            for f in files_written:
                if f.path.endswith(".csv") and "part-" in f.path:
                    final_csv_path = f"{output_dir}/voters_export_{timestamp}_batch{batch_num+1}.csv"
                    mssparkutils.fs.cp(f.path, final_csv_path)
                    print(f"   üìÑ Exported batch {batch_num + 1} to: {final_csv_path}")
                    break
            
            # Clean up temp folder
            mssparkutils.fs.rm(temp_output_dir, recurse=True)
    else:
        print(f"   üì¶ Processing entire dataset as a single file")
        
        # Write to temporary CSV folder
        temp_output_dir = f"{output_dir}/temp_{timestamp}"
        
        df.coalesce(1).write \
            .option("header", "true") \
            .option("quoteAll", "true") \
            .option("escape", "\\") \
            .option("quoteMode", "quoteMode.ALL") \
            .option("lineSep", "\n") \
            .mode("overwrite") \
            .csv(temp_output_dir)
        
        # Locate and rename the .csv file
        files_written = mssparkutils.fs.ls(temp_output_dir)
        for f in files_written:
            if f.path.endswith(".csv") and "part-" in f.path:
                final_csv_path = f"{output_dir}/voters_export_{timestamp}.csv"
                mssparkutils.fs.cp(f.path, final_csv_path)
                print(f"   üìÑ Exported to: {final_csv_path}")
                break
        
        # Clean up temp folder
        mssparkutils.fs.rm(temp_output_dir, recurse=True)
    
    print(f"‚úÖ Export process completed successfully!")

except Exception as e:
    print(f"‚ùå Failed to process: {str(e)}")
    import traceback
    print(traceback.format_exc())
